definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: the massive foot stomps down where he just was.
sentences.chinese: 机甲硕大的脚重重地踏在他刚才的位置上。

sentences.english: Baboons have a large head, cheek pouches, and a long, doglike muzzle.
sentences.chinese: 狒狒头部硕大，有颊囊，鼻口部狭长似狗。

sentences.english: The broad seal was impressed with Winthrop's coat of arms.
sentences.chinese: 硕大的火漆封蜡上盖着温思罗普的纹章。

sentences.english: Mine was balky and awkward, brand new, and of a light, common color.
sentences.chinese: 我的却硕大笨拙，簇新，颜色浅而平凡。

sentences.english: Gradually, the sun, which is like a huge egg, is popping out of the clouds slowly.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐地，太阳像一个硕大的鸡蛋黄慢慢跳出云层。

sentences.english: Please look at this glittering and matchlessly-large Precious Bottle Gourd above.
sentences.chinese: 大家看上方这个宝葫芦，它金光闪闪，硕大无比。

sentences.english: He was a big man with a cigar and a camel's-hair coat.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个抽着雪茄，穿着驼毛大衣，体形硕大的男人。

sentences.english: There was an enormous cat crouching on the counter.
sentences.chinese: 柜台上蜷伏着一只硕大的猫。

sentences.english: Ben must have been a great big man.
sentences.chinese: 老班一定是一个体形硕大的巨人。

sentences.english: With the great black piano appassionato.
sentences.chinese: 和着硕大的漆黑钢琴的热情满溢。

sentences.english: A dark stubble was shrouding his strong jaw and dimpled chin.
sentences.chinese: 硕大有凹陷的下巴上满是深色的短须。

sentences.english: Our Art office building is located in front of our office building.
sentences.chinese: 办公楼前面是艺术楼，右边则是我们硕大的操场。

sentences.english: He first saw a high mountain of golden hair under a large round hat.
sentences.chinese: 他首先看到的是一个硕大的圆帽下一头金色的长发。

sentences.english: A dark stubble was shrouding his strong jaw and dimpled chin.
sentences.chinese: 硕大干瘪的下巴上满是黑黑的胡茬儿。

sentences.english: The Centaur Warchief s mammoth body is capable of absorbing great amounts of punishment.
sentences.chinese: 半人马酋长硕大的身躯可以承受相当大的打击。

definition: perfectly round/(fig.) accommodating/considerate/smooth (way of doing things)
(of sb or sth) whole or entire body
to inlay/to embed/to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring)/tiling/tesselation
